subject: Technology
title: iOS vs Android: The Great Divide
description: A fast breakdown of iOS vs Android: The Great Divide for builders.

hook.text: Ask people which phone they prefer and you might start an argument that lasts for hours.

buildup.text: iOS is tightly controlled. Apple designs the hardware, software, and store as one seamless system.

discovery.text: Android is open and flexible. You can customize almost anything, but quality varies between devices.

twist.text: Apple has 27% market share but captures over 80% of smartphone industry profits.

climax.text: The real divide is philosophy: Apple controls the experience; Android gives you the freedom.

punchline.text: iOS sells polish. Android sells choice. Both win differently.

quiz.question: What is the core difference between iOS and Android?
options: iOS is free, Android costs money
iOS is controlled by Apple; Android is open and customizable
Android only works on Samsung phones
